bullets.text: Trump revokes EPA “endangerment finding,” sharply weakening federal climate regulation; could shift compliance costs, emissions trajectory, and litigation risk for automakers and utilities.
New analysis finds U.S. consumers bear much of tariff costs; Supreme Court delays clarity, sustaining pricing uncertainty for import-heavy sectors.
U.S. signs trade deal with Taiwan: tariffs lowered to 15% and Taipei boosts purchases of U.S. goods, deepening economic alignment amid China tensions.
Equities sell off on AI disruption fears; Dow dips below 50,000 while long-term Treasuries rally—classic risk-off rotation and growth-scare pricing.
Energy leads S&P 500 performance beyond crude’s rise, reflecting improved capital discipline, shareholder returns, and resilient cash flows.
Electricity prices rise about twice inflation; AI/data-center demand expected to keep power tight, influencing CPI components and industrial site selection.
January home sales fall over 8%, signaling renewed housing stress as affordability and rates constrain demand.
Anthropic closes $30B round at $380B post-money, underscoring continued capital concentration in frontier AI and intensifying compute/talent competition.
Apple shares drop on FTC scrutiny and reported Siri delays, highlighting rising regulatory and execution risk for major platform ecosystems.
Rivian beats Q4 expectations and targets major production increases; investors re-rate growth potential, emphasizing software’s role in EV competitiveness.
Waymo begins fully autonomous operations with its 6th-gen driver, marking a commercialization milestone and raising new questions on labor, liability, and city regulation.
H5N1 kills over 50 skuas in Antarctica’s first wildlife die-off there, expanding geographic risk and strengthening the case for global surveillance and biosecurity.
Worst coral-bleaching event on record damages over half of reefs, increasing climate-related ecosystem loss risks and potential downstream impacts on fisheries and tourism.
Epstein files spark corporate and political fallout; Goldman’s general counsel resigns, highlighting reputational, governance, and compliance risks for major financial institutions.
